page.title: 19The Haywood Society.
page.content: The Haywood Society emerged from an action group who formed to object to the planned telephone exchange. As a result of their objection the planned height was reduced. They then became affiliated to the Civic Trust and formed an amenities society. Over the 10 years of their existence they have helped by tidying the crossroads and railway enbankment, making proposals to local councils which they think might be a help to the area such as an access road from the by-pass to St. Mary's, and by objecting to some planning applications, for example the proposal of a tip at the site of the old brickworks, as it is a marvellous habitat for wildlife and needs preserving. There are approximately 75 members who meet monthly. Meetings are often addressed by guest speakers.
